ygData.subject: Re: I have the answers.
ygData.msgSnippet: I am aware of the location you mentioned, but she only sells SKEWER Molds (and others) and not SCALER molds... At least not the times I have visited her, which
ygData.messageBody:
I am aware of the location you mentioned, but she only sells SKEWER Molds
(and others) and not SCALER molds... At least not the times I have visited
her, which has been many... Or, do these go by some other name?

Also, thanks to everyone for explaining that there are no holds/caps on
Skill training...

I just hope I have the plat to get up high enough!

I put 20 practices into smithing to start, and when making 'bits' (which no
longer increase my skill) I am only getting about a 60% success rate! I am
currently at level 28 now, but it has cost me 30 plat to get there... Why?
because I cannot increase by making Files either, and because I cannot find
SCALER molds (supposed to be next easiest) I am forced to practice using
skewers... Of this, I have been increasing, but only made ONE out of over
40! (the very FIRST time I tried it in fact!)

Needless to say this is very frustrating, time and money consuming... Moreso
than I would have thought... At this rate, it could end up costing me 100's
of Plat before I can make anything to sell for a Profit (per item that is),
but makes me wonder if I shouldn't just spend the plat and buy stuff for
myself and not worry about making any for sale...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric

> From: "Reedo" <reedo@...>
>
> Both skewers and scalers can be found in East Freeport. They are in a
store
> right around the corner from the armor shop. I think it is called the
> travelers something. There are two doors. One has two people inside and
> the other has a woman. The woman has all the molds you need to practice
> with. As for the second question. There are no skill caps on trade
skills.
> I am level 14 and have an 86 is blacksmithing right now. If you have the
> cash you can learn as long as you want.
>
> Arden
> Cazic-Thule
